thread.title: NYT Travel spotlights new hotel in Durham
thread.title_full: NYT Travel spotlights new hotel in Durham

author: Rebecca Troyer
title: NYT Travel spotlights new hotel in Durham
text: Travis Dove The Durham, a boutique hotel located in a former Home Savings Bank and Mutual Community… more The Durham Hotel, which opened July 10 at 315 E. Chapel Hill St. , is highlighted in New York Times Travel's weekly feature, "Travel News and Tips ." "The one-time Home Savings Bank now houses 53 guest rooms that reference the building’s midcentury design roots in platform beds and retro light fixtures," writes the Times. "The minibar is stocked with locally made goods, blankets were made by Raleigh Denim and complimentary morning coffee, delivered to the rooms, comes from local Counter Culture Coffee. In the lobby, a newsstand includes music from the local label Merge Records." A shout-out is also given to Andrea Reusing's new restaurant inside The Durham, which is slated to open later in the month. Home of the Day
